body.p:
Winchester Ky
April 27th/64
To His Excellency Governors
Thomas E Bramlette
Dear Sir:

I have received a letter from madison County Ky requesting that I should make known to you the Wish of the Union men in that County as to the appointment of Charles Walker to the office of Col of Militia I understand his appointment is desired by his friends and the Union Citizens of said County I know the family well and they are good Citizens. I hope if compatible
with the interest of the State Service you will cause him to be appointed

I am as ever yours
friends
Jas H G Bush

Madison Co
Ky State Militia
Madison Co
April 27. 1864
Bush J. H. G.
At the request of the Union men of Madison he recommends Mr. Chas Walker, as a suitable to fill the vacancy caused by declaration of J H Caperton

Commissioned issued. Ap 29.64
Recd I. G. O. April 29. 1864
